title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Logan Airport honor Sept. 11, 2001, attack victims.
Gates B32 and C19 are where hijacked Flights 11 and 175 departed from on September 11, 2001.
Flags were raised shortly after 9/11 by airline employees as a tribute without formal ceremony.

title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 56% of Massachusetts residents approve of Governor Maura Healey's performance, with 20% strongly approving according to a MassINC poll.
Healey's approval is highest among Democrats, college-educated voters, and women over 50, but lowest among non-degree holders.
Healey's approval outpaces Donald Trump's, with 48% of Bay State residents strongly disapproving of Trump, according to the poll.

title: Where to find college student discounts in Greater Boston
author: Frances Klemm, Nia Harmon and Laura Emde
bullets: AMC Theatres in Boston offer special student pricing for tickets purchased in person with a valid student ID.
Boston Symphony Orchestra offers a $35 student pass for most performances with website reservation.
Students get discounted Boston sports tickets, including Red Sox games starting at $9 through the Student9s program.

title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: U.S. Rep. Lori Trahan criticized the Market Basket board for firing CEO Arthur T. Demoulas, describing the store as central to her upbringing.
The board's decision follows a feud with Demoulas, who was on leave amid an investigation into alleged disruptive work stoppages.
Demoulas's spokesperson claimed the firing was predetermined and part of a cover-up, while Trahan emphasized the store's community impact.

title: What Jabrill Peppers said about his surprising release from the Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers, released by the Patriots, has signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers and expressed excitement about the move.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel cited 'team's best interest' for releasing Peppers, a decision he described as difficult.
Peppers, set to face New England soon, is eager to learn Pittsburgh's defense and contribute to his new team.

title: Mark Wahlberg is filming a new movie on the North Shore
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Mark Wahlberg is filming the movie 'Weekend Warriors' in Lynn, Massachusetts, a project co-produced by LeBron James.
'Weekend Warriors' is directed by Stephen Chbosky and involves a father-son journey to discover a favorite NBA team.
Filming in Lynn is expected to continue through October, with Apple TV+ releasing the film later.

title: What’s the deal with this art installation near South Station made entirely of coolers?
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 'Elevar La Cultura', a gold pyramid of coolers by Victor 'Marka27' Quiñonez, is displayed near South Station.
The installation, consisting of spray-painted coolers, honors street vendors and challenges immigration policies with cultural symbolism.
It will remain in Boston's Dewey Square until December before moving to sanctuary cities across the U.S.

title: FBI releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk’s assassination
author: The Associated Press
bullets: The FBI released photos of a person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassination, showing an individual in a hat and sunglasses.
Charlie Kirk was shot with a Mauser .30 caliber rifle at Utah Valley University, and the shooter remains unidentified.
Authorities appealed for public information as they investigate the targeted attack that drew widespread political condemnation.

title: Paul Pierce said Jayson Tatum’s injury ‘made it easier’ for Celtics to move Holiday, Porzingis
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Paul Pierce says Jayson Tatum's injury eased decisions to trade Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis.
Celtics aim to manage luxury tax with trades, moving Porzingis to Hawks and Holiday to Portland.
NBA ranks Celtics 12th in Eastern Conference amid roster changes and Tatum's injury recovery.

title: MassGOP to pay $36K after allegations of illegal donations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: The Massachusetts Republican Party agreed to pay over $36,000 after allegations of illegal donations were settled.
Donations totaling $36,759.45 in 2022 included a large contribution from Dean Tran's congressional campaign, now serving prison time.
Current MassGOP leaders cooperated with the investigation and attributed the violations to "sloppy accounting practices."
